ref: 12401 śāráṅga (śāraṅgá -- ŚBr.) ʻ spotted ʼ Br. (AV.?), m. ʻ a kind of deer ʼ Kālid., ʻ the Indian cuckoo ʼ Suśr., sāraṅgī -- f. ʻ a doe ʼ Kathās., ʻ female of a partic. bird ʼ Mn. (= śārṅgī -- f. MBh., śārgá -- m. VS.?). [EWA i 235 following J. Przyluski JA 1921, 321 sees in it an Austro -- as. prefix ~ kuraṅgá -- 1. But despite more usual v.l. sāraṅgá -- 1, it is difficult to separate from śārá -- 1 which has same meaning and ś -- attested in NIA.]
Pa. sāraṅga -- m. ʻ a spotted deer ʼ,
M. sārãgā ʻ dark -- bay (of horses) ʼ;
Si. saran̆gā, saragā ʻ the spotted deer Axis maculata ʼ, haran̆ga -- yā ʻ a bird of the cuckoo family, Ceylon hornbill ʼ.
